conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D, and the task is to predict which container (E or F) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
The liquid from A, B, C, and D flows downwards.
The streams are directed by the angled bars towards the center.
The yellow baffle directs the liquid flow further downward and slightly to the left.
The red baffle redirects the flow to the left, guiding the liquid towards the container area.
The liquid from A, B, C, and D ultimately flows towards the left side.
The streams primarily reach containers E and F.
A larger portion of the liquid is likely to enter container E due to the leftward guidance by the red baffle.
The liquid will flow into containers E and F.
